author: Staff Reporter
text:
The new building of the Vellore South police station which was inaugurated on Thursday.— Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

Chief Minister Jayalalithaa inaugurated a new building for the Vellore South police station via video conferencing from Chennai on Thursday.

The two-storey building has come up after the old structure was razed last year. The building has been constructed at a cost of Rs. 70.50 lakh. Construction work began on March 12, 2015, and was completed recently, according to a police officer.

The earlier building, which was close to 80 years old, was demolished to pave way for the new one. “This new building will house the crime and law and order stations. There are two lock ups, one each for men and women, here,” he said. The station was shifted to another premise during the construction work. Work to move into the new building has commenced.
title: Vellore South police station gets a new building
